title: 'My granddad has changed our world for generations to come'
text:
Sue, Lynne and Grace and Esme are three generations of the James family, from West Yorkshire. Errol, Sue’s father came to the UK in the 1940's Windrush era when he was 18 years old. Aged 26, he married Winnie.

Errol was also one of the six founding members of the Jamaica Society in Leeds, a founding member of the Caribbean Cricket Club in 1948, and the Leeds West Indian Centre in 1982.

By the time he died in 1994 he'd been awarded an MBE for his services to community and race relations. He'd also been made a Justice of the Peace.
description: The descendants of a Windrush immigrant explain the impact he had.
